 1 <?php
 2 
 3 namespace UserFrosting;
 4 
 5 /**
 6  * DatabaseTable Class
 7  *
 8  * A data class representing a database table.  Specifies the table name and whitelisted columns.
 9  * @property string $name the name of the database table.
10  * @property array $columns an array containing the names of the columns in this database (not including the `id` column).
11  * @package UserFrosting
12  * @author Alex Weissman
13  * @see http://www.userfrosting.com/tutorials/lesson-3-data-model/
14  */
15 class DatabaseTable {
16     
17     /**
18      * @var string The name of the table.
19      */
20     protected $_name;
21     
22     /**
23      * @var array[string] A list of the allowed columns for this table.  The `id` column is already assumed.
24      */
25     protected $_columns; 
26     
27     /**
28      * Create a new DatabaseTable instance.
29      *
30      * A DatabaseTable object is used to encapsulate information about a particular table in your database.
31      * UserFrosting expects all tables to have an `id` column as their primary key.
32      * You can register it with the main data model by using Database::setSchemaTable().
33      * @param string $name the name of the table in your database.
34      * @param array[string] $columns a list of the column names, not including the `id` column (which is already assumed to exist).
35      */
36     public function __construct($name, $columns = []){
37         $this->_name = $name;
38         $this->_columns = $columns;
39     }
40     
41     /**
42      * Add additional columns to this DatabaseTable instance.
43      *
44      * @param string $x,... the additional column names to insert.
45      * @return DatabaseTable this DatabaseTable object.
46      */
47     public function addColumns() {
48         $new_columns = func_get_args();
49         $this->_columns = $this->_columns + $new_columns;
50         return $this;
51     }
52     
53     /**
54      * Set the table name for this DatabaseTable instance.
55      *
56      * @param string $name the new name for this DatabaseTable.
57      * @return void
58      */    
59     public function setName($name){
60         $this->_name = $name;
61     }
62     
63     /**
64      * Magic getter for DatabaseTable properties.
65      *
66      * @param string $name the property to return (either 'name' or 'columns').
67      * @return string|array the table name, or an array containing the table columns
68      * @throws Exception attempted to access a nonexistent property.
69      */      
70     public function __get($name){
71         if ($name == "name"){
72             return $this->_name;
73         } else if ($name == "columns"){
74             return $this->_columns;
75         } else {
76             throw new \Exception("The value '$name' does not exist in the table configuration object.");
77         }
78     }
79  
80 }
